abstract: Jay Quade of University of Arizona and team of geologists explain phenomenon of stones in Atacama Desert of Chile that have mysteriously smooth mid-sections; contend stones rolled down from nearby hills after being dislodged by earthquakes.
snippet: Thousands of peculiar boulders in the Atacama Desert have smooth midsections more typical of rocks in water. New research suggests that earthquakes caused them to polish one another over a million years.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of peculiar boulders in the Atacama Desert have smooth midsections more typical of rocks in water. New research suggests that earthquakes caused them to polish one another over a million years.

headline.main: Smooth Desert Boulders May Be Quakes’ Work
headline.seo: Quakes Shook Atacama Desert Boulders Smooth, Scientists Say
headline.print_headline: Smooth Desert Boulders May Be Quakes’ Work
